Yes, it can be disheartening when countries and groups continue to violate the Geneva Convention and other international treaties despite efforts to enforce them. However, it's important to remember that change takes time, and progress may not be visible immediately. International law, including the Geneva Convention, is still relatively new, and it takes ongoing effort and commitment from all parties involved to ensure compliance.

One approach that can be effective is to continue to hold violators accountable for their actions through investigations and sanctions, while also engaging in dialogue and building relationships to foster change. This can include providing support for civil society organizations, investing in education and awareness-raising efforts, and supporting efforts to strengthen the rule of law.

It's also important to remember that progress is often incremental, and every step towards ensuring compliance with the Geneva Convention and other international treaties is a step in the right direction. By continuing to work towards these ends, we can help to create a more just and peaceful world.
